entries.title: Getting Started with Svelte 5
entries.summary: Svelte 5 introduces runes, a new way to handle reactivity. In this post we explore $state, $derived, and $effect — the three runes you'll use most often.
entries.content:
Svelte 5 introduces runes, a new way to handle reactivity. In this post we explore $state, $derived, and $effect — the three runes you'll use most often.

What are runes?

Runes are special compiler instructions that replace the old reactive declarations ($:) with explicit, composable primitives.
entries.author: Jane Developer

entries.title: Tailwind CSS v4: What's New
entries.summary: Tailwind CSS v4 brings a new engine, CSS-first configuration, and significantly faster builds. Here's everything you need to know about the upgrade.
entries.author: Bob Styles

entries.title: Building Offline-First PWAs
entries.summary: Progressive Web Apps that work offline provide a reliable experience regardless of network conditions. We'll build one from scratch using service workers and the Cache API.
entries.content:
Progressive Web Apps that work offline provide a reliable experience regardless of network conditions.

We'll build one from scratch using service workers and the Cache API.
entries.author: Jane Developer

entries.title: GitHub Actions Now Supports Arm64 Runners
entries.summary: GitHub has announced general availability of Arm64 runners for GitHub Actions, offering up to 40% cost savings for compatible workloads.

entries.title: TypeScript 6.0 Beta Released
entries.summary: The TypeScript team has released the first beta of TypeScript 6.0, featuring improved type inference, faster compilation, and new decorator metadata support.
entries.author: News Desk
